page.title: 02FISH FARMING ON THE FIRTH
page.content:
Though two thirds of this section are the waters of the Cromarty Firth, this does provide the setting for one of the newer industries in Scotland. Four of the pupils of Newhall School visited the Fish farmout in the bay, spending a most enjoyable afternoon learning how fish are farmed and helping to feed them. The farm was first started some three years ago by Robert Davie, a fish merchant from Cromarty. Then. with three partners, and assisted by a loan from the Highlands and Islands Development Board, the Cromarty Salmon Company, was formed. Mr. Davie is now managing director and the firm employs a manager and a young assistant who is working under the Youth Opportunities scheme. Brian
